mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know On September 16, 1976, South Africa saw a demonstration against the Black Education System, which forced students to learn Afrikaans.

en: On the fateful day of June, students were to have a peaceful march to Orlando Stadium as a sign of resistance against the new language policy.

en: The Democratic Alliance (DA) has described as irrational and obscure a law that strips South Africans of their citizenship.
tsn: Mokgatlho wa Democratic Alliance (DA) o tlhalositse molao o o sa utlwagaleng le go tlhaloganyega o o amogang maAforika Borwa boagi jwa bona.
mt0: The Democratic Alliance (DA) explained the unexplained and unexplainable law that allows South Africans to become citizens of their own country.

en: This follows complaints from citizens based in London who tried to renew their South African citizenship, only to discover that they are no longer South African citizens because they have claimed additional citizenship.
tsn: Se se latela dingongorego go tswa go baagi ba ba nnang kwa London, fa ba leka go ntšhwafatsa boagi jwa bona jwa Aforika Borwa, ba lemoga fa ba sa tlhole e le baagi ba Aforika Borwa ka gonne ba kopile tlaleletso ya boagi.
mt0: It follows complaints from residents living in London, trying to suppress their South African nationality, realizing that they are no longer South African citizens because they have applied for citizenship.

en: This is because, under the current Citizenship Act in South Africa, you have to first apply to the Department of Home Affairs for permission to get another citizenship.
tsn: Se ke ka ntlha ya gore, ka fa tlase ga Molao wa Boagi mo Aforika Borwa wa ga jaana, o tshwanetse go dira kopo kwa Lefapheng la Merero ya Selegae go bona tetla ya go bona boagi jwa naga e nngwe.
mt0: That's because, under the current Citizenship Act in South Africa, you must apply to the Local Government Office to obtain a visa to a foreign national.

en: However, DA MP Adrian Roos says the party is opposed to this law and will fight it in the High Court on behalf of thousands of South Africans who have lost their citizenship without their knowledge.
tsn: Le gale, Leloko la palamente la DA Adrian Roos a re lekoko le kgatlhanong le Molao o, mme le tlaa lwantshana le ona kwa  kgotlatshekelong e e kwa godimo mo boemong jwa diketekete tsa MaAforika Borwa a a latlhegetsweng ke boagi kwa ntle ga kitso ya bona.
mt0: However, the Democratic Alliance MP Adrian Roos said the party was against the law, and it will fight it in a high court in the case of thousands of South Africans who were robbed without their knowledge.

en: The DA is challenging this law in court.
tsn: DA e gwetlhana le Molao ono kwa kgotlatshekelo.
mt0: Return only the translated translation. If you cannot translate the law simply say you don't know.

en: It is not a particularly rational law seeing as the Department of Home Affairs has previously stated that it has nothing against dual citizenship.
tsn: Ga se molao o o utlwagalang jaaka le Lefapha la Merero ya Selegae le kile la tlhalosa gore ga le kgatlhanong le boagi jwa dinaga tse pedi.
mt0: It's not a constitutional issue as the Local Government Department has already stated that it is not against the citizens of both countries.

en: But if that’s your policy, then you must not say you support dual citizenship.
tsn: Fela ke molao wa lona, lo seke lwa re lo tshegetsa boagi jwa dinaga tse pedi.
mt0: Only return to the original. If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: If you look at the interim Constitution, it spoke about the fact that no citizen shall be without justification, and this was changed in the final Constitution.
tsn: Fa o lebelela Molaotheo wa nakwana, o bua ka ntlha ya gore ga go moagi yo a tlaa nnang kwa ntle ga tshegetso ya molao, mme se se fetotswe mo Molaotheong.
mt0: If you look at the temporary Constitution, you say that no citizen will live without legal protection, but that has been changed in the Constitution.

en: They removed the words without justification to say this right should obsolete that you shouldn’t be deprived of your citizenship.
tsn: Ba tlositse mafoko ntle le go tlhalosa gore tshwanelo eno e tshwanetse e seke ya tsenngwa tirisong gore o seke wa ganelwa ka boagi jwa gago.
mt0: They removed the words without specifying that this right should not be used to prevent being discriminated against by your citizenship.

en: So the argument of the DA is that if anything, you should have to legitimately and actively renounce your citizenship before you can lose it, says Roos.
tsn: Ka jalo ngangisano ya DA ke gore, le fa go ka nna jang, o tshwanetse go nna le tumelelo ya go ka tlogela boagi jwa gago pele bo ka go latlhegela, go bua  Roos.
mt0: The debate in the DA is that, regardless of what, you must have the permission to leave your citizen before it can lose you, said Roos.

en: Below is the full interview with DA MP Adrian Roos.
tsn: Fa tlase, ke ditherisano tse di feleletseng tsa leloko la DA Adrian Roos.
mt0: In the bottom, are the final talks of DA Adrian Roos.

en: Deputy President David Mabuza has weighed in regarding the R150 million Digital Vibes scandal allegedly linked to Health Minister Zweli Mkhize.
tsn: Motlatsamoporesitente David Mabuza o ntshitse maikutlo a gagwe ka ga ditatofatso tse di maswe tsa dimilione di le R150 tsa Digital Vibes tse di golaganngwang le Tona ya Boitekanelo, Zweli Mkhize.
mt0: The deputy prime minister David Mabuza has expressed his concerns about the serious allegations of R150 million of digital vibe corruption against the health minister, Zweli Mkhize.

en: He was addressing a group of military veterans in Limpopo on Saturday.
tsn: O ne a bua le setlhopha sa baitseanape ba maloba ba sesole kwa Limpopo ka Lamatlhatso.
mt0: He spoke to a former army commander in Limpopo on Saturday.

en: The Special Investigative Unit (SIU) is probing allegations that the minister benefited from the money paid to Digital Vibes to do public relations work for the department.
tsn: Yuniti e e kgethegileng ya dipatlisiso (SIU) e sekaseka ditatofatso tsa gore tona o nnile le seabe mo mading a a duetsweng Digital  Vibes go dira le tiro e e amanang le setšhaba ya Lefapha.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: The Democratic Alliance (DA) is among those calling for the resignation of Mkhize.
tsn: Mokgatlho wa Democratic Alliance (DA) ke mongwe wa mekgatlho e e e batlang gore Mkhize a role tiro.
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: Mabuza says people should wait for the outcome of the investigation.
tsn: Mabuza a re batho ba tshwanetse go emela dipoelo tsa patlisiso.
mt0: Mabuza said people should wait for the results of the research.

en: Of course if there are allegations they will always disrupt the thinking of government
tsn: Ke nnete gore, fa go na le ditatofatso, ba tlaa thibela dikakanyo tsa puso
mt0: If there are accusations, they will block government plans.

en: But I think we should take from what the President has said that this is being attended to.
tsn: Fela ke akanya gore re tshwanetse go tsaya  se Moporesidente a se buileng gore kgang e e lebeletswe.
mt0: I think we should take the President's statement as a warning that the issue is being treated.

en: Earlier the Special Investigation Units Kaizer Kganyago says they’re still investigating and plan to conclude the probe soon.
tsn: Pejana, Kaizer Kganyago wa Yuniti ya Dipatlisiso tse di Kgethegileng ,o rile ba sa ntse ba batlisisa mme ba ikaeletse go konosetsa patlisiso e ka bonako.
mt0: Previously, Kaizer Khanyago of the Independent Research Institute said that they are still investigating and hope to further the research soon.

en: Deputy President David Mabuza says about R654 million meant to assist military veterans is lying idle in the Department of Defence and is not being used because the department has not been working properly.
tsn: Motlatsamoporesitente David Mabuza a re dimilione di ka nna  R654 tse di tshwanetseng go ka bo di thusa baitseanape ba badiredi ba sesole di sasaila fela mo Lefapheng la Tshireletso mme ga di dirisiwe ka gonne lefapha le ntse le sa dire sentle.
mt0: The deputy prime minister David Mabuza said that about R654 million would have been used to help the army's intelligence officers but were spent in the Security Department and not used because the department is not working well.

en: Mabuza was addressing a group of military veterans in Limpopo on Saturday.
tsn: Mabuza o ne a bua le setlhopha sa baitseanape ba badiredi ba sesole kwa Limpopo ka Lamatlhatso.
mt0: Mabuza spoke to a military commander in Limpopo on Saturday.

en: He has urged military veterans to form one single group instead of fighting one another.
tsn: O kopile baitseanape ba sesole gore ba ipope go nna ngatana e le nngwe go na le gore ba lwantshane ka bo bona.
mt0: He asked the soldiers to become one army rather than fight against each other.

en: Well, the money has not been used, it lies in the department because there is a number of problems, but the military veterans are complaining.
tsn: Le gale, madi ga a ise a dirisiwe, a dutse kwa lefapheng ka gonne go na le mathata a le mantsinyana, fela baitseanape ba badiredi ba sesole ba a ngongorega.
mt0: However, the money has not been used, it is still in the bunker because there are a few problems, but the commanders of the military are complaining.

en: The biggest problem that we are facing is the verification program which affects the no statutory forces.
tsn: Bothata jo bogolo jo re lebaganeng le jona ke lenaneo la netefatso le le amang thata tlolo molao .
mt0: The biggest problem we have is the verification system . If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know .

en: Mabuza says he hopes that now that a Director-General of the department has been appointed, military veterans will get the assistance they want.
tsn: Mabuza a re o solofela  gore ka jaanong Mokaedi-Kakaretso wa Lefapha o setse a tlhophilwe, bagaka ba sesole ba tla fitlhela thuso e ba e batlang.
mt0: Mabuza said he hoped that now that the Ministry's Chief of Staff has been elected, the soldiers would find the help they needed.

en: He has urged military veterans across all the political spectrum to organise themselves and to enable the government to adequately support them.
tsn: O rotloeditse bagaka ba sesole go ralala dikarolo tsotlhe tsa sepolotiki go ipaakanya le go letlelela puso go leka go ba tshegetsa.
mt0: He encouraged the soldiers to coordinate across all political parties and let the government try to support them.

en: Military veterans often complain about a lack of decent housing, health services, and jobs.
tsn: Bagaka ba Sesole go le gantsi ngongorega ka ga tlhokego ya matlo, ditirelo tsa boitekanelo tse di nang le seriti, le go tlhola ditiro.
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: Disunity among veterans.
tsn: Go tlhoka tirisanommogo magareng ga bagaka.
mt0: If you cannot translate it simply say you don't know.

en: Mabuza says disunity and groupings among military veterans and ex-combatants are undermining the government’s efforts to address their challenges.
tsn: Mabuza  a re go tlhoka tirisanommogo  le ditlhophatlhophana magareng ga bagaka ba sesole le masole a maloba ke go nyatsa matsapa a puso mo go samaganeng le dikgwetlho tsa bone.
mt0: Mabuza said that the need for cooperation between the military and the former army was to reject the government's efforts to deal with their problems.

en: He says military veterans from former liberations parties are also battling with verification of struggle credentials.
tsn: O rile bagaka ba badiredi ba sesole go tswa kwa makokong a tokologo a maloba le bona ba sokola ka go netefatsa dintlha tsa bona tsa boitshupo.
mt0: He said that former military officers from the past freedom period also struggled to verify their evidence.

en: You must try and organise yourselves, we don’t want these groupings amongst yourselves because we don’t understand why you are fighting amongst yourselves.
tsn: Lo tshwanetse go leka le go ipaakanya ka bolona, ga re batle ditlhophatlhophana tseno magareng ga lona ka ntlha ya gore ga re tlhaloganye gore goreng lo lwa ka bolona.
mt0: If you can't translate, just say you don't know.

en: You are a community that is getting smaller and smaller, you are a community that is aging so why would old people fight among themselves, MKVA, and the military council you must go and solve your issues with immediate effect.
tsn: Lo setšhaba se se nnang se fokotsega gannyane le gannyane, le setšhaba se se tsofalang jaanong goreng batsofe ba ka batla go lwantshana ka bo bona, MKVA, le Khansele ya sesole tsamayang  go rarabolola mathata a lona ka bonako.
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: It’s not good for this community.
tsn: Se ga se a siamela setšhaba se.
mt0: He didn't approach the people.

en: Mabuza interacts with veterans from the South African Defence Force, Mkhonto we Sizwe, Azanian People’s Liberation Army, and the Venda Defence Force in Polokwane, Limpopo.
tsn: Mabuza o buisana le bagaka go tswa kwa South African Defence Force, Mkhonto we Sizwe, Azanian People Liberation Army le  Venda Defence Force kwa Polokwane, Limpopo.
mt0: Mabuza is speaking with troops from South African Defence Force, Mkhonto we Sizwe, Azanian People Liberation Army and Venda Defence Force in Polokwane, Limpopo.

en: Deputy President David Mabuza engaged with veterans from the South African Defence Force, Mkhonto we Sizwe, Azanian People’s Liberation Army and the Venda Defence Force.
tsn: Motlatsamoporesitente David Mabuza o tlotla le South African Defence Force, Mkhonto we Sizwe, Azanian People Liberation Army le  Venda Defence Force.
mt0: The deputy prime minister David Mabuza congratulated South African Defence Force, Mkhonto we Sizwe, Azanian People Liberation Army and Venda Defence Force.

en: Although they are still disgruntled, veterans believe there is now a glimmer of hope.
tsn: Le fa ba ne ba sa itumela, bagaka ba dumela gore go na le kganya ya tshepo.
mt0: Although they were not happy, the brothers believed that there was a light of hope.

en: I am from Azania MVA, hopefully, our problems will be attended to once the partnership can be forged between us and the national government.
tsn: Ke tswa kwa Azania MVA, ka tsholofelo, mathata a rona a tlaa rarabololwa, fa fela go ka nna le tirisanommogo magareng ga rona le puso ya bosetšhaba.
mt0: I am from Azania MVA, I hope that our problems will be resolved, if we can work together with the national government.

en: MK National Councils Emmanuel Maake says, We have had all the sorts of problems including health, housing, pensions & school fees for children, we are basically struggling.
tsn: Emmanuel Maake wa khansele ya bosetšhaba ya MK  a re, re  nnile le mathata a mefuta yotlhe go akaretsa le boitekanelo, matlo, diphenšene le dituelo tsa bana ba sekolo, re na le mathata a mantsi tota.
mt0: Emmanuel Maake of the national committee of the MK said, we have had problems in all areas including health, housing, housing, housing and education, we have a lot of problems.

en: Some military veterans were not happy that they were denied entry to the venue where Mabuza was addressing them.
tsn: Bagaka ba Sesole ba bangwe ba ne ba sa itumelela gore ba ne ba ganelwa go tsena kwa lefelong le Mabuza o neng a ba ema ka lefoko kwa go lona.
mt0: Some soldiers were not happy that they were refused entry to the place Mabuza told them.

en: They were not on the list of those who were expected to enter the rugby stadium.
tsn: Ba ne ba se mo lenaaneng la ba ba neng ba tshwanetse go tsena kwa lebaleng la metshameko la Rakabi.
mt0: They were not on the list of those who had to go to the rugby stadium.

en: The Inkatha Freedom Party (IFP) led by Nquthu Municipality in northern KwaZulu-Natal is taking the provincial Cooperative Governance Department to court for placing it under administration.
tsn: Lekoko la Inkatha Freedom Party (IFP) le eteletswe pele ke Mmasepala wa Nquthu kwa Bokone jwa kgaolo ya KwaZulu-Natal le isa Lefapha la Taolo ya Kopanelo ya porofense kwa kgotlatshekelo ka ntlha ya fa le tsentswe ka fa tlase ga tsamaiso.
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know The Inkatha Freedom Party (IFP) is led by the Mayor of Nquthu in the north of KwaZulu-Natal and has taken the provincial Community Control Department to court for being involved in the scheme.

en: The decision was announced by COGTA MEC, Sipho Hlomuka on Thursday.
tsn: Tshwetso e, e dirilwe ke MEC wa COGTA, Sipho hlomuka ka Labone.
mt0: If you can't translate this simply say you don't know.

en: He cited a recent audit outcome and a high court ruling that the appointment of certain acting senior managers was irregular.
tsn: O ne a nopola dipolelo tsa boruni tsa ga jaana le dikatlholo tsa  kgotlatshekelo e e kwa godimo tsa gore go tlhomiwa ga batsamaisi ba bangwe ba bagolo ba nama o sa tshwere go ne go  sa tlhomama.
mt0: He remembered the rumors of the jungle and the high court rulings that some chiefs were appointed without a waiting order.

en: The Nquthu council has argued that the MEC has no basis to place the municipality under administration.
tsn: Khansele ya Nquthu e boletse gore MEC one a sena dithata tsa go baya mmasepala ka fa tlase ga tsamaiso.
mt0: The council of Nqutu said that MEC had no power to bring the city under control.

en: The decision to challenge Hlomuka’s action was taken during a council meeting on Thursday, a day after the provincial Cooperative Governance Department announced that it is placing the municipality under administration.
tsn: Tshwetso ya go gwetlha dikgato tsa  ga Hlomuka e tserwe ka nako ya kopano ya Khansele ka Labone, letsatsi morago ga porofense ya Lefapha la Taolo ya Kopanelo e dira kitsiso ya go baya mmasepala ka fa tlase ga tsamaiso.
mt0: The decision to suspend Hlomuka's actions was taken at the council meeting on Thursday, the day after the province's Community Control Department announced the introduction of the city under a system.

en: In February, the provincial government placed the municipality under administration.
tsn: Ka Tlhakole, puso ya porofense e ne ya baya mmasepala ka fa tlase ga tsamaiso.
mt0: In October, the provincial government placed the municipalities under control.

en: But the decision was overturned by the National Minister of Co-operative Governance Dr. Nkosazana Dlamini-Zuma.
tsn: Mme tshwetso e ne ya busediwa morago ke Tona ya Bosetšhaba ya puso, ngaka Nkosazana Dlamini-Zuma.......
mt0: The decision was reversed by the Prime Minister, Dr. Dlamini-Zuma....

en: She argued that there was no substantial reason to place the municipality under administration.
tsn: O boletse gore go ne go sena  lebaka le le utlwalang la go baya mmasepala ka fa tlase ga tsamaiso.
mt0: He said that there was no reason to put the city under administration.

en: I think this intervention is not genuine, but a political ploy by MEC because in March Dr. Nkosazana Dlamini Zuma turned down an earlier decision by COGTA in the province to place the municipality under administration.
tsn: Ke akanya gore tsereganyo eno ga e se boammaaruri, mme ke leano la la ga MEC ka gonne ka kgwedi ya Mopitlwe Ngaka Nkosazana Dlamini Zuma  o ganetsane le tshwetso ya COGTA mo porofenseng ya go baya mmasepala ka fa tlase ga tsamaiso.
mt0: I think this explanation is not true, but it is a MEC plan because in October Dr. Nkosikazi Dlamini Zuma rejected the COGTA's decision to put municipalities under supervision.

en: Dlamini- Zuma instead recommended that the provincial government intervene with Section 139 1A which means they could monitor, guide, and assist the municipality.
tsn: Dlamini- Zuma, ka jalo o gakolotse gore puso ya porofense e ikamanye le Karolo 139 1A e e kayang gore ba ka baya leitlho, ba kaela, le go thusa mmasepala.
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know Dlamini-Zuma, so he advised the provincial government to adhere to Article 139 1A which means that they can monitor, advise, and help municipalities.

en: But Cogta in KZN did not do that.
tsn: Fela  COGTA  ya kwa KZN ga ya dira  jalo.
mt0: If you can't translate it, just say you don't know. But COGTA in KZN doesn't do that.

en: Yes, we did get a disclaimer audit outcome, but the reasons for that, the previous senior managers, when they left they deliberately took with them crucial information which was required for auditing purposes, says Mayor Lindokuhle Shabalala.
tsn: Ee, re fitlhetse dipoelo tsa boruni tsa go sa dire kopotuelo, fela mabaka a seo, batsamaisi ba ba fetileng, fa ba ka tsamaya ba tsamaile le tshedimosetso e e botlhokwa le bona e e neng e tlhokega mo maikaelelong a go runa, ga bua Lindokuhle Shabalala.
mt0: Yes, we have found the negative effects of a lack of planning, but for that reason, former managers, if they could have gone, would have gone with important information that was needed in the planning procedures," said Lindokuhle Shabalala.

en: Nquthu municipality threatens to take COGTA to court
tsn: Mmasepala wa Nquthu o dira matshosetsi a go isa COGTA kwa kgotlatshekelo
mt0: The Nquthu City Council is making a threat to bring COGTA to court. If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: The IFP in KwaZulu-Natal has accused Hlomuka of helping the African National Congress (ANC) to run the municipality through the back door by placing it under administration.
tsn: IFP  ya kwa KwaZulu-Natal e latofaditse Hlomuka ka go thusana le African National Congress (ANC) go tsamaisa mmasepala ka tsela e e sa siamang, ka go e tsenya ka fa tlase ga tsamaiso.
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: Provincial party chairperson, Thamsanqa Ntuli says the ANC is hell-bent on running the Nquthu Municipality even though they lost elections in the area.
tsn: Modulasetulo wa Lekoko la Porofense, Thamsanqa Ntuli o rile ANC e batla go tsamaisa Mmasepala wa Nquthu le fa ba latlhegetswe ke ditlhopho mo lefelong leo.
mt0: The provincial committee chairman, Thamsanqa Ntuli, said that ANC wanted to run the Nquthu municipal council even if they lost the local elections.

en: We are all quite aware that the IFP and the ANC are working well in the City of Johannesburg but here in KZN it’s a different story.
tsn: Rotlhe re itse gore sentle gore IFP le ANC ba dira sentle mo Toropong ya Johannesburg fela  mo KZN ke kgang e e farologaneng.
mt0: We all know that the IFP and ANC are doing well in Johannesburg, but in KZN it's a different story.

en: Hence you see the agenda against all our municipalities in the province of KZN.
tsn: Ke ka foo o bonang lenaanetema le le kgatlhanong  le bommasepala ba rona botlhe mo porofenseng ya KZN.
mt0: That's why you see this banner against all our cities in KZN.

en: We are quite very concerned with the behaviour of COGTA and MEC for COGTA who actually is allowing the narrow agenda of ANC councillors in Nquthu to be guiding the activities of COGTA, it’s quite very unfortunate.
tsn: Re tshwenyegile thata ka maitshwaro a COGTA le Mokhuduthamaga wa COGTA  yo a letlelelang lenaanetema la bakhansela ba ANC  mo Nquthu go kaela ditiro tsa COGTA, se se swabisa thata.
mt0: We are very concerned about COGTA's attitude and the COGTA Chairman who has allowed the ANC leadership to oversee COGTA's activities, which is very disappointing.

en: The IFP is also unhappy with the ANC after it named one of its regional structures in the far north of the province after its late freedom fighter, Nobleman Mzala Nxumalo.
tsn: IFP e swabisitse gape ke ANC morago ga go neela leina la nngwe ya ditheo tsa kgaolo mo porofenseng go ya kwa bokone, leina la molwela kgololesego, moswi Nobleman Mzala Nxumalo.
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know. If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: It also says the move would regress reconciliatory talks between the two parties spearheaded by leaders of both parties at the national level.
tsn: E rile, kgato e, e tlaa busetsa kwa morago dipuisano tsa itshwarelano magareng ga makoko a mabedi a a neng a bolotswa ke baeteledipele ba makoko a ka bobedi kwa maemong a bosetšhaba.
mt0: He said that this would restore the peace talks between the two parties that were saved by the leaders of both parties in international situations.

en: Deputy President David Mabuza has assured military veterans that government does not have hard cash to give to military veterans but has money to take care of their social and health needs.
tsn: Motlatsamoporesitente David Mabuza o netefaditse bagaka ba sesole gore puso ga e na madi  mo seatleng go neela bagaka ba Sesole fela puso e na le madi a go tlhokomela ditlhokego  tsa bona tsa loago le ditlhokego tsa boitekanelo.

en: Today we are in Limpopo at the Polokwane Rugby Stadium and warmly welcomed by Premier Stanley Mathabatha.
tsn: Gompieno re mo Limpopo kwa lebaleng la Rakabi la Polokwane mme re amogetswe ka diatla tse di bothito ke Tonakgolo, Stanley Mathabatha.

en: Deputy President David Mabuza in his capacity as the chairperson of the Presidential Task Team on Military Veterans is expected to interact with military veterans at Polokwane in Limpopo.

en: For years, military veterans from both former liberation political parties and the then Transkei, Bophuthatswana, Venda and Ciskei (TBVC states), have been complaining that government is not doing enough to take care of their livelihood.
tsn: Mo dingwageng tse di fetileng, Bagaka ba Sesole go tswa kwa makokong a sepolotiki le a Transkei, Bophuthatswana, Venda le Ciskei (dinaga tsa TBVC), ba ntse ba ngongorega gore puso ga e dire ka mo go lekaneng go tlhokomela matshelo a bona.
mt0: In the past few years, soldiers from the political and ethnic communities of Transkei, Bophuthatswana, Venda and Ciskei (TBVC) have been complaining that the government does not do enough to protect their lives.

en: Amongst other things the task team led by Deputy President Mabuza identified, is the need for social distress relief, providing educational assistance, decent housing and land for military veterans.
tsn: Gareng ga tse dingwe tse di lemogilweng ke setlhopha sa tirelo se se eteletsweng pele ke Motlatsamoporesitente Mabuza, ke tlhokego ya namolo ya tlalelo ya loago, go neela thuso ya thuto, kago ya matlo a a nang le seriti le lefatshe go Bagaka ba Sesole.
mt0: Another priority identified by the service committee led by Vice President Mabuza is the relief of the housing crisis, providing education support, building a suitable housing and land for the soldiers.

en: In a statement from the Presidency, the Task Team continues to receive reports on progress achieved by different departments, to come up with a legislative framework to help military veterans.
tsn: Mo setatamenteng se se tswang kwa kantorong ya Moporesidente, Setlhopha sa Tirelo se tswelela go amogela dipegelo tsa tswelelopele e e fitlheletsweng ke mafapha a a farologaneng, go tla ka letlhomeso la peomolao go thusa badiredi ba sesole.
mt0: In the report from the President's office, the committee continues to receive reports of progress made by various organizations, including a criminal investigation to assist military officials.

en: Former Presidents legal team led by Advocate Dali Mpofu has, through a statement in terms of a special plea, accused State Advocate Billy Downer of lacking independence and impartiality.
tsn: Setlhopa sa molao sa moporesidente wa maloba se se eteletsweng pele ke mmueledi Dali Mpofu, go ya ka mabaka a boikuelo jo bo kgethegileng se latofaditse mmueledi wa puso Billy Downer ka tlhaela go ikemela ka nosi le go se tseye letlhakore.
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know. The former Attorney General's Office, headed by Attorney Dali Mpofu, took the case against the former Attorney General Billy Downer for being a failure to stand up for himself and not taking sides.

en: Mpofu says that Zuma had been, in his own words, crying for his day in court and offered up a lengthy explanation as to why his client believed he would not receive a fair trial as long as Advocate Downer led the States case.
tsn: Mpofu a re Zuma o ne, go ya ka mantswe a gagwe, a lelela letsatsi la gagwe kwa kgotlhatshekelong mme gape a tlhalosa gore ke ka ntlha ya eng modirelwa wa gagwe a sa amogele tsheko e e lolameng fa mmueledi Downer a tsamaisa kgetse ya puso.
mt0: According to Mpofu, Zuma, according to his words, was waiting for his trial and also explained why his lawyer didn't accept a fair trial when Downer was conducting the parliamentary committee.

en: There are facts and circumstances that give me a reasonable impression that Mr. Downer had conducted himself in a manner that lacks the independence and impartiality that is necessary for a lawful prosecution.
tsn: Go na le dintlha le maemo tse di nnayang mabaka a a utlwalang a gore Rre  Downer o ne a itshwere ka mokgwa o o bontshang a sa kgone go ikemela ka nosi le go tlhoka go tsaya letlhakore mo go leng botlhokwa mo tiragatsong ya molaong.
mt0: There are certain facts and circumstances that indicate that Mr Downer was acting in a way that shows that he was not able to stand up for himself and that he needed to take a stand in the important legal affairs.

en: Mr. Downer failed to uphold the standard and prosecutorial independence needed to secure that my trial is fair and conducted in accordance with the Constitution, Mr. Downer placed himself as a witness against me when he filed an affidavit in support of the Democratic Alliance application to review and set aside a decision by the NPA to terminate my prosecution.
tsn: Rre. Downer o reteletswe ke go tshegetsa maemo a a tlhokegang go sireletsa boikemedi jo bo tlhokegang go netefatsa gore tsheko ya me e lolame mme e tsamisiwa go ya ka Molaotheo, Rre Downers o ipeile ka boene go nna paki kgatlhanong le nna fa a ne a tsenya afidafiti  ya go tshegetsa kopo ya Democratic Alliance ya go sekaseka le go beela kwa thoko tshwetso ka NPA ya go fedisa tshekiso ya me.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know Mr. Downer has been responsible for maintaining the necessary procedures to ensure that my case is fully prosecuted and enforced under the Constitution, Mr. Downers has taken the initiative to become a witness against me when he filed an affidavit to support the Democratic Alliance's request to review and withdraw the decision by the NPA to end my trial.

en: Despite Zumas so-called Stalingrad tactics employed to use every legal aspect to his disposal to halt his prosecution, he failed to convince the courts that the charges should be dismissed due to alleged political interference in the states case against him.
tsn: Le fa Zuma a dirisitse maano a a bidiwang a botsipa a a a tsentsweng tirisong go dirisa dintlha tshotlhe tsa molao go emisa tsheko ya gagwe, o paletswe ke go dira gore dikgotlhatshekelo di dumele gore dikgetse tsa gagwe di beelwe kwa thoko ka ntlha ya sepolotiki mo kgetseng ya puso kgatlhanong le ena.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: Thales faces four charges, one of racketeering, two of corruption and one of money laundering.
tsn: Thales e lebane le dikgetse di le nne, nngwe ya kgwebo ya boferefere, tse pedi tsa bobodu le e le nngwe ya tsamaiso ya madi a a sa tlhomamang.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know. Thales faces four options, one of which is a corporate disaster, two of which are illegal mining and one of which is a financial crisis.

en: State accuses Zuma and Thales of organising and conducting a racketeering enterprise, a charge which carries a maximum sentence of 25 years imprisonment.
tsn: Puso e latofatsa Zuma le Thales ka go rulaganya le go tsamaisa kwebo ya boferefere, molato o, o na le bogolo jwa katlholo ya dingwaga di le 25 kwa kgolegelong.
mt0: The government accuses Zuma and Thales of planning and carrying out a coup plot, a charge that carries a maximum of 25 years in prison.

en: The state alleges that Zuma received hundreds of payments amounting to millions of rands via his then financial adviser, convicted fraudster, Shabir Shaik, at the time of the arms deal acquisition process in the 1990s.
tsn: Puso e latofatsa Zuma ka go amogela makgolokgolo a dituelo tse dimilione tsa diranta go tswa go mogakolodi wa gagwe wa madi, yo o bonweng molato, Shabir Shaik, ka nako ya tsamaiso ya go fitlhela tsa dibetsa ka di ngwaga tsa bo 1990.

en: The state alleges that Zuma received a bribe of R500 000 a year from Thales, facilitated by Shaik.
tsn: Puso e latofatsa Zuma gore o amogetse pipamolomo ya R500 000 ka ngwaga go tswa kwa Thales, e eteletswe pele ke shaik.
mt0: The government accuses Zuma of receiving millions of dollars a year from Thales, led by a shaik.

en: Other charges against Zuma include fraudulent tax claims and returns, non-disclosure of financial assistance to Parliament and lying to the institution about meeting with representatives from the arms manufacturer.
tsn: Ditatofatso dingwe kgatlhanong le Zuma di akaretsa lekgetho, go se senole ya thuso ya madi go palamente, le go aketsa setheo ka kopano le baemedi ba go tswa  kwa modiring wa dibetsa
mt0: Some of the concessions against Zuma include taxes, a freeze on parliamentary aid, and a settlement with representatives from the arms maker.

en: Advocate Downer has told the court the State was not yet ready to respond to the special plea, referring to the over 1 000-page document as voluminous.
tsn: Mmueledi Downer o boleletse kgotlhatshekelo gore puso e ne e ise e siamele go tsibogela kopo e e kgethegileng, ba lebisitse go tokomane e kgolo ya ditsebe tse di fetang 1 000.

en: He says that it covered the lengthy litigation period.

en: The Bishop says despite all the darkness the country is faced with, there is hope.

en: We have seen the darkness of corruption, Gender-Based Violence, poverty, hunger; the list goes on.

en: As Easter people, we do not despair; we do not lose hope.

en: It is because of the good news of Easter that we lift up vaccination as a sign of hope, calling for it to be made available to all; whether they are rich or poor, she says.

Se ke go ya ka Alon Gal, mothei-mmogo wa setheo sa bonokwane jwa mo inthaneteng, Hudson rock.

en: She says before Jesus died, there was what seemed like a spiritual midnight, much like the past year for many people.
tsn: O rile pele Jeso a tlhokofala, go ne go na le selo se e keteng ke semowa sa bosigogare, fela jaaka ngwaga o o fetileng mo bathong ba le bantsi.

en: Before Jesus shouted out, Father into your hands I commit my spirit, notice how the Bible tells us that the sun was darkened.

en: It seemed like a spiritual midnight had covered the whole earth.

en: This last year for many people, it has indeed felt like midnight in their lives.

en: The South African Council of Churches (SACC) has likened the pain and isolation suffered by many victims of COVID-19 as the same pain and humiliation that Jesus Christ suffered during his crucifixion.

en: And whatever humiliation God goes through, God refuses to give up on us.

en: We heard him cry out why have you forsaken me?

mt0: We heard him cry, saying, What did you do to me?

en: And in that moment that of crying out, it’s a reminder to those who cry out as they face their own death through the COVID-19 pandemic, the 52000 or so people who have lost their lives in this nation and they have lost their lives almost alone.
tsn: Mme mo nakong eo ya selelo, ke gakologelo mo go bao ba lelang sefatlhego se lebile fatshe fa ba lebagane le loso la bona ka ntlha ya leroborobo la Khorona, batho ba ka nna 52000, ba latlhegetswe ke matshelo a bona mo setšhabeng se mme ba latlhegetswe ke matshelo a bona ka nosi.
mt0: But in this time of grief, it is a reminder to those who are weeping with their faces lowered when they remember their deaths because of the coronavirus pandemic, about 52,000 people who lost their lives in the nation and their lives alone.

en: But we want to remind you as family members to them, that they did not go through this alone because this God has experienced loneliness of death and cried out, why have you forsaken me?
tsn: Fela re batla go gakolola wena jaaka leloko la lelapa la bona, gore ga ba leba seno ba le esi gonne Modimo ono o nnile le maitemogelo a bodutu jwa loso mme a lela, go reng o ntlogetse?
mt0: We want to remind you, as a member of their family, that they don't see this as their own because this God has experienced the evil of death and has weeped, why did you leave me?

en: We have hear him cry out I thirst.

mt0: We heard him cry and say I was sick.

en: At that moment, we are reminded of Gods solidarity and all those who struggled with their bodies giving in to death in ICU, in ventilation and all the places where death seems to win, says Molo.
